thread.title: Shoplifting Arrest Leads To Drug Charges
thread.title_full: Shoplifting Arrest Leads To Drug Charges

title: Shoplifting Arrest Leads To Drug Charges
text:
Shoplifting Arrest Leads To Drug Charges October 13, 2015, 11:01 AM SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
A shoplifting in Sioux Falls led police to arrest two on drug charges. 
At 11:42 p.m. Monday, Sioux Falls Police were called to Walmart, 3209 S. Louise Ave., after a woman was reportedly caught shoplifting. Police found her at a nearby business parking lot with reported stolen items from the store. While arresting her for shoplifting, officers found syringes and meth. 
Police also found the man accused of dropping her off. While searching his car, officers found 53 pills of lorazepam, 2 bags of meth totaling 41 grams, a bag of heroin weighing 1.9 grams, and a trace amount of marijuana. 
Thirty-year-old Claudia L. Leon, of Tucson, AZ, and 48-year-old David Lee Green, of Sioux Falls, were both charged with shoplifting and various drug charges. This article has been revised to reflect the following correction: The number of pills was updated to 53. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
